name: DUPLEX LOFT 2 - SAN TELMO
neighborhood_overview: San Telmo is one of the best neighborhoods in the city of Buenos Aires, and the way to find out is living a few days in, enjoying its picturesque streets, taking a coffee in one of its notable bars or dining at any of the innumerable restaurants . Visit art galleries, going to museums, explore the Sunday antiques fair on Defensa, or play in a milonga tango dance watching local and why not learn a few steps. Also the weekend has lots of fun. I know many places to eat or get out, but do not recommend them because as long as you walk in my neighborhood I feel like newcomer, I think San Telmo always new things to discover secretly.

neighborhood_overview:
Palermo is the best neighborhhod in the city.
It s famous for night life, shops, restaurants and bars
You ll find everything here.
Also is the safest area in the city.
It is a mix of bohemian, touristic, young and trendy area.
host_about:
Thanks for considering my place to enjoy a wordeful time at buenos Aires.I live in the city since I borned, more than 30 years ago._x000D_
I love travelling so I love the experience to host people at my apartaments. I m not an agency (thats that manage a lot of apartments). Each apartment is mine._x000D_
I have travelled around the world: Usa, Germany, Hong Kong, Thailand, France, Check Rep, Spain, Mexico, Chile, Cuba and more!  From all this places I have to say that Buenos Aires is one of the most amazings cities in the entire world._x000D_
I m an apasionate "porteÃ±o" (person that lives in Buenos Aires). I also love music and movies ( I m a big of Martin Scorsese Â´s and Alex de la Iglesia films)_x000D_
Here you may find the best restaurants, argentinians or food from all over the world (india, china, brazil, spain, italian, japan and more)._x000D_
Tango music and dance will catch you, and you may fall in this passion..._x000D_
I ll do my best as a host, to give you an incredible experience in our city_x000D_
I m a person that love and enjoy to work _x000D_
I speak english, spanish, portuguese, some french and italian!!!_x000D_
When you came to my places, I will give you some special tips for your trip! There are some important advices that you may know when you come to Argentina_x000D_
My places always are sunny, with good furniture. I m a honest and responsable owner._x000D_
Let me know you too !!!_x000D_

description: This beautiful, modern and roomy first floor apartment (no lift available) was refurbished only 5 years ago and is conveniently located in the Palermo district, just two blocks away from Santa Fe Avenue, the Alto Palermo shopping center.

host_about:
Musician, former sociology and journalism student and River Plate fan. As I was born in Venezuela but have lived in Argentina since 11 I`m familiarized with many cultures and life styles. I`ve travelled all around the world since a kid (Europe, US, Caribbean, South America). Big interest in music (rock, folk, reggae, bossa nova, tango, cumbia, funk, hip hop, electronic...), movies (big fan of Tarantino) football (soccer) and reading.
I have lots of recommendations for my guests! restaurants, football matches, typical touristics spots, tango, live music, parks, clothing stores, cool places in the suburbs and many more.

neighborhood_overview:
Palermo, without a doubt, is the best area in the whole city.

name: Remodeled in Palermo Soho
description:
LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. ThatÂ´s all about when it comes to Bs. As.
WeÂ´ve just finished remodeling this apartment thinking how we would like to stay if we were visiting Buenos Aires.
neighborhood_overview:
Palermo is a quiet and familiar neighbourhood with several points of interest where you can enjoy good food, nightlife and shopping. It has a great combination of peaceful walks and social activities which makes it the most popular tourist destination in Buenos Aires. No wonder it is called the "it" place of the city :)
Palermo Soho is a small area of Palermo Viejo around Plaza Armenia and Plaza Serrano. It is a newly fashionable area for fashion, design, restaurants, deli, bars and street culture. The atmosphere in many cafÃ©s and restaurants strives to be "alternative", which makes this area of the city specially popular with young, upper-middle class Argentinians as well as foreign tourists. The traditional low houses have been adapted into boutiques and bars, creating a bohemian feel. The two main squares of the area have crafts fairs and a very recommended food market.
Also you are a walking distance from green areas like Palermo Woods, Zoo, and Botanical Gardens, Planet
host_about:
I'm a guy that believes in a different way of doing tourism, getting involved with the locals and trying to live and feel the culture of the different places we visit. That's why I love the idea of Airbnb._x000D_
Please, if youâ€™ve got any questions or youâ€™re planning on coming to Buenos Aires, feel free to contact me. Cheers! _x000D_

name: 350sqFt Studio Palermo/280sqFt private backyard
description: This sunny studio apartment is over 35 sq. meters indoor and 40 sq. meters outdoor. Located on the ground floor in the heart of Palermo Soho, you'll enjoy a very quiet private garden with a nice barbecue.
neighborhood_overview:
It's a great central location, ideally positioned between Plaza Italia and Plaza Serrano. So you're within easy walking distance of both, 3 blocks away are all the transport links (subte D and many many bus lines) of Plaza Italia on nearby Santa Fe. You're a short walk to parks, the Botanic Gardens, and of course all Palermo Soho's famous boutiques, restaurants, bars and nightlife are on your doorstep.
Local amenities including supermarkets, organic food shops, restaurants/pubs, discos/bars, ice cream parlours, local internet coffee shops, banks and ATM machines are all within a few blocks.

A very short cab ride away are Las Canitas, with its restaurants, bars and polo fields; the Costanera, with its top nightclubs; Aeroparque Jorge Newberry, the domestic airport; Recoleta, with its lovely architecture and stunning cemetery; and San Telmo, with its historical buildings and markets.

BELGRANO, BUENOS AIRES, ARGENTINA:

Belgrano is a middle and upper class neighborhood located in the north of Buenos Aires.

The Belgrano neighborhood has great commercial, residential, and historical importance within the city of Buenos Aires, Argentina.

neighborhood_overview: Palermo Chico is the area of Palermo that concentrates the majority of the parks and museums. Then, there are many restaurants around: Panini, Farinelli and Dandy are the bests. And there is an organic food place right over the corner. Lastly, the main attractions of Recoleta (Cemetery, Fine Arts Museum, Plaza Francia, National Library and BA Design) are 15 minutes away walking distance by Libertador avenue.

neighborhood_overview:
San Telmo is the most touristic district per excellence. Colonial mansions and cobbled streets remind us of colonial Buenos Aires. The oldest neighborhood in the city with soul of tango and candombe. Filled with antique and design shops.
In addition to the craft stalls, there are also street performers, musicians, dancers, puppeteers, magicians and living statues. In the evenings, the neighborhood is transformed, and the bars where the tango is heard and danced coexist with the lively pubs and live music.

A few blocks away are milongas and tango bars in the Almagro neighborhood.

host_about:
Hey!!! 

I am Federico Di Sarno!, I am from Argentina and I am 38 years old.
I am a lawyer who travels a lot for Business as well as for pleasure.

I would like to become part of the Community by offering my nice flat in Buenos Aires and also to have the chance to find places to stay when overseas! :)

My intention is to provide the best stay for everybody. Understanding needs comes only if you really travelled and felt real needs. 

I love sports (Corssfit, football, Volleyball, Running), cultural activities, Cooking, Travelling, Reading, sharing time with friends and of course travelling (from Mountains to Beach).

Be my guest, feel at home!.

Thank you for your attention! :)

Fede.

description: Tastefully refurbished traditional old house with original style and modern vibe. Spacious and silent, with high ceilings, private patio and terrace. Privileged location in the union of three of the most emblematic and vibrant neighborhoods of the city: Recoleta, Palermo and Almagro. Excellent connection with public transport and easy access to traditional tango places, characteristic restaurants, bars, shopping and green areas. A unique opportunity to enjoy the rhythm and charm of Buenos Aires.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in a strategic point at the confluence of three of the most vibrant and emblematic neighborhoods of Buenos Aires: Recoleta, Palermo and Almagro. It is a quiet and cozy space in the heart of a busy and stimulating area, that provides a comforting rest from the exciting, dynamic buzz of the city.

In the area there is a profusion and a variety of bars, restaurants, coffee shops, wineries, craft breweries, milongas (venues for tango dancing & music), theaters, musical venues and cultural centers, which can be reached in a few minutes on foot, by taxi or public transport.

It is a strategic location for travelers who come to Buenos Aires to dance tango and who wish visit several milongas in a single night, as the locals do.

name: Palermo Pop
description: Modern apartment in the heart of Palermo, impeccable.
neighborhood_overview:
That is Palermo in a nutshell. This vibrant area of the bohemian suburb Palermo Viejo sits between Santa FÃ©, Coronel DÃ­az, CÃ³rdoba, and Juan B. Justo streets. This is one of the trendiest parts of Palermo (along with Palermo Hollywood) and a favorite place of backpackers, hipsters and designers. It is the home of lazy and wooded cobblestone streets where new businesses continue to arise in the old Spanish style houses and converted warehouses.
The best boutiques in Buenos Aires are here, from clothing stores and leather goods specialists to bookstores and wine shops. What makes it even more attractive is that the shops are expertly located in recycled houses, old warehouses and elegant old houses. Wander the streets of Armenia, Malabia and Gurruchaga and you will discover this amazing neighborhood.

neighborhood_overview:
Palermo is the largest neighborhood in Buenos Aires. It is located in the northeast of the city, bordering the neighborhoods of Belgrano to the north, Almagro and Recoleta to the south, Villa Crespo and Colegiales to the west and the RÃ­o de la Plata to the east.
Although it appears as a large strip on the official map, Palermo can be subdivided into several contrasting and individual parts: Palermo Viejo, Palermo Soho, Palermo Hollywood, Palermo Chico, CaÃ±itas and Alto Palermo.

Especially Palermo Soho, CaÃ±itas and Palermo Hollywood have become the new trendy area of Bs As in fashion, design, restaurants, bars and street culture. The atmosphere in many cafes and restaurants strives to be â€œalternativeâ€, which makes this area of the city especially popular with young upper-middle-class Argentines and foreign tourists. Traditional low houses have adapted to boutiques and bars, creating a bohemian vibe. Come and enjoy!!!

neighborhood_overview:
San Telmo is the most touristic district per excellence. Colonial mansions and cobbled streets remind us of colonial Buenos Aires. The oldest neighborhood in the city with soul of tango and candombe. Filled with antique and design shops.
In addition to the craft stalls, there are also street performers, musicians, dancers, puppeteers, magicians and living statues. In the evenings, the neighborhood is transformed, and the bars where the tango is heard and danced coexist with the lively pubs and live music.

description:
Lovely apartment located in the heart of one of the nicest neighbourhoods in Buenos Aires.
The apartment is inside of a French style building with all it's impressive features and it has just been fully renovated. Light and airy one bedroom apartment with all the amenities you will need to fully enjoy your stay in this vibrant city. neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located very well, in the heart of Buenos Aires and is very close to the iconic centers and tourist attractions. Located between the two best neighborhoods of the city: Retiro and Recoleta, Retiro was one of the most exclusive neighborhoods in Buenos Aires. This location is characterized by the great houses of the 20th century, the art deco apartments and the emblematic buildings of the city.

The apartment is perfectly located in the heart of Buenos Aires and it provides an excellent base to walk around the citie's landmarks and tourist attractions. It is located between two of the fanciest neighbourhoods in the city: Retiro and Recoleta, Retiro was once the most exclusive neighbourhood in Buenos Aires. Tango is always present in the house and in the neighborhood.
We appreciate people who know how to enjoy the beautiful things in life.
neighborhood_overview:
San Telmo is the historic center of Buenos Aires, located 1000 meters from the financial center of the country, and many others of the Modern Puerto Madero, anteroom of the Rio de la Plata.
San Telmo has a cultural offer in terms of museums, musical shows and world-class theaters designed for Argentinians, so that the visitor will not fall into artificial tourist offerings.
Its gastronomy is well representative of Argentinian cuisine but there are also Peruvian, Russian, German, Italian, Indian, and Arab restaurants.

Originally settled by English and Irish immigrants, the community was named after the John Coghlan train station that runs through it. One of the places worth checking out in Coghlan is AlmacÃ©n Plutarco, which sells fresh-baked artisanal bread that looks like itâ€™s designed by elves! name: 61 - Loft in Palermo Hollywood, Fitz Roy St.
description:
Modern & Sunny Duplex Loft in Palermo Hollywood

ENJOY BARS AND RESTAURANTS, REST IN A QUIET ENVIRONMENT. The apartment has a unique location, close to the city center and with beautiful views of Palermo. A horizon without limits, which invites you to clear your mind and allow you to enjoy gastronomy in its fullness.
neighborhood_overview:
In Palermo you can find a wide variety of restaurants, try La Mar for Peruvian food, Cucina Paradiso for Italian, Club Omakase for Japanese , Tegui or Osaka for extravagant Argentine food. If you are looking for something more relaxed but tasty, try Bar Du Marche for wines and cheeses, Siamo Nel Forno for Italian, or Sunae or Sudestada for Asian.

This area is also great for a night out. El Nacional is a good option for beers, Festival or Club Lucero for a more lively bar and TetuÃ¡n if you also want to eat something. If you like a club, Makena and Niceto Club are the best.

But if you are in the neighborhood during the day, don't miss the cafes and patisseries, which also serve lunch and even brunch on the weekends. The best are Birkin, Adorado and Oui Oui.

neighborhood_overview:
Palermo Hollywood is one of the most modern and vibrant neighborhoods in Buenos Aires, Argentina. It is located in the northern part of the city, bordering the neighborhoods of Palermo Soho, Colegiales and Belgrano.

Palermo Hollywood is known for being home to Argentina's film and television industry, and it's named after the sheer number of film and TV production studios found in the area.

The neighborhood has a wealth of bars and restaurants, offering a wide variety of dining options ranging from traditional Argentine cuisine to international food. There are also plenty of fashion stores, boutiques, and art galleries, making Palermo Hollywood an ideal place for art and fashion lovers.

As for nightlife, Palermo Hollywood is known for its trendy bars and clubs, where music and dancing are present late into the evening. There are also several cultural spaces, including theaters and art centers, that offer a variety of shows and events throughout the year

We love living in Soho because it's one of the tourist and safe places in BA. Palermo is the center of everything today. There are bars, cafes, gastronomy, art and design, designer clothing, theatres and all walking distance.
A few meters from the apartment you find everything you need to do your shopping such as supermarkets (Chinese too), kiosk, grocery stores, butcher, hairdressers, beauty salon, yoga room, gyms, all meters away.
The apartment is on Darregueyra Street between Paraguay and Guatemala in the Palermo Soho neighborhood 200 meters from the beautiful Arcos District Shopping, 300 meters from the famous Don Julio restaurant (excellent Argentine grill), El Preferido, and on foot you arrive at CafÃ© Borges with its great bookstore and presentation of musical events. In front of the CafÃ© Borges is the Teatro Ciego (experience to feel at least once! Unforgettable) and you are already in the middle of the typical Palermo streets with lights from the feet of the trees

neighborhood_overview:

It is located in the geographical center of the city, which means a privileged position. Whether it is for transportation to or from other neighborhoods, or for being a nucleus that connects different areas, being the center facilitates its development.

The Puerto Pampa complex (Refrigerator 'La Pampa') is part of the Catalinas Sur neighborhood.

A small neighborhood located at the entrance of La Boca, between the Argerich Hospital, the Buenos Aires-La Plata highway and Necochea Street. There are just eleven blocks, 28 buildings and five duplex complexes, which we call â€œthe little housesâ€, but there live about 10,000 people. It's an urban nook that has no asphalt. Only sidewalks: Cars can't go through. And it's the best place in Buenos Aires to be a kid.

The Catalinas Sur floor makes the first difference with the rest of the grey of the City, its pink tiles.
The image of this place is summarized into two stripes of colors. Downstairs, the floor of a salmon tone. Upstairs, the green of the endless trees. In between buildings and cottages.

Built in the 1960s, â€œan oasisâ€ within the chaos of Buenos Aires.

I could assure you that it is less hot than in the rest of the City: the sky is cove

High speed internet.

Perfect for families or friends.

Supermarkets, metro, public transport and city bike station, all very close.

It is also close to the Movistar Arena (14 blocks), approximately 20 minutes walking or 5 minutes by car.

neighborhood_overview:
San Telmo is one of the best preserved areas within the always dynamic and ever-changing Buenos Aires and is characterized by its colonial cottages and streets, many of which continue to be cobblestone.

Temporary art galleries, late-night bars, and street murals lend the iconic San Telmo Neighborhood, Home to the Historic Center, a bohemian and mystical atmosphere that makes it unique.

Filled with antique stores and rustic steakhouses, Defense Street cuts through Dorrego Square, which houses a flea market and street performers that attract tourists from all over the world every Sunday.

In Lezama Park, trails wind around tall jacaranda trees and the Italian National Historical Museum. The neighborhood has many establishments that offer dinners with tango shows.

Among its main attractions are: Mercado de San Telmo, one of the oldest markets still standing in the city; the

name: Hermoso Departamento 130 mt en zona Alto Palermo
description: Beautiful and stylish apartment for the whole family in a stylish building in the heart of Palermo neighborhood.
neighborhood_overview:
With its bohemian-chic atmosphere, Palermo brings together the best of art, fashion, bohemianism and an eclectic local cuisine, which together with its nightlife at the height of the world's big cities, give it a world-renowned footprint and make it the go-to for national and international tourism.

With this denomination this area of Buenos Aires has been recognized since the beginning of the 18th century. Its name comes from the Casa del Retiro, built at the beginning of this century at the intersection of the current Arenales and MaipÃº by the governor AgustÃ­n de Robles, very close to the hermitage of San SebastiÃ¡n, there existing already in 1608. Shortly afterwards the house was sold to the South Sea company, and was intended to house the slaves who had arrived in Buenos Aires.

In 1800 construction work began on Plaza de Toros, whose contour is still maintained in Plaza San MartÃ­n, on Avenida Santa Fe. During the English invasions a memorable confrontation took place in it, following which the place received the name of Field of Glory. There the grenadiers under General JosÃ© de San MartÃ­n also received instruction, and the place began to have importance because of the barracks that moved the bullring. From this, the site was renamed the Field of Mars.

neighborhood_overview:
The Recoleta neighborhood is one of the most stylish and exclusive neighborhoods in the city of Buenos Aires. It is located in the north of town, bordering the neighborhoods of Retiro, Palermo, Barrio Norte and Balvanera.

Recoleta is known for its wide tree-lined avenues, beautiful mansions, and elegant French-style buildings. It is also famous for its cemetery, which houses the tombs of many important historical figures from Argentina, including Eva PerÃ³n.

In the heart of Recoleta is the Plaza Francia, a large green space where the Craftsman's Fair is located every weekend and is a popular place to buy local handicrafts and souvenirs are located every weekend and is a popular place to buy local handicrafts and souvenirs.

In turn, it has nightlife and gastronomy of the best, as well as boutique shops and shopping centers.

Villa Urquiza is a charming neighborhood in Buenos Aires, offering a delightful mix of urban living and serene residential ambiance. Boasting a rich history, the neighborhood is notable for its tree-lined streets, traditional architecture, and the presence of numerous open spaces and plazas.

The area is known for its vibrant gastronomic and shopping hub. From international cuisine restaurants to local cafes and fashion boutiques, Villa Urquiza has something for everyone. In addition, the presence of supermarkets and local shops ensures all daily necessities are within reach.

In terms of transportation, Villa Urquiza is highly accessible. With its proximity to the Line B subway, several bus routes, and train stations, it provides easy access to the rest of the Capital Federal.

name: Calm Apartment in Palermo
description: Discover the perfect blend of beauty and tranquility in this stunning Palermo apartment. This peaceful oasis boasts modern amenities, serene surroundings, and a prime location. Ideal for those seeking a peaceful retreat in the heart of vibrant Palermo.
neighborhood_overview:
Palermo, a neighborhood with its own soul in Buenos Aires, is a place that embraces you with its diversity and energy. Here, daily life mingles with creativity and culture on every corner. Its tree-lined streets host charming shops, cozy cafes, and restaurants where laughter and delicious meals are shared. Palermo is an artistic haven, with art galleries and street murals that tell unique stories. And if you seek a break in the midst of the city, parks like Bosques de Palermo offer peace and a close connection to nature. Explore local markets, savor Argentine cuisine, and dive into the nightlife that makes Palermo truly unforgettable. Whatever your passion, be it art, food, or simply enjoying a lively atmosphere, Palermo awaits you with open arms.

Some notable destinations near by:
- 50m from Don Julio
- 50m from El Preferido
- 4 blocks away from main transport hub Plaza Italia
host_about:
I like to think I'm simple persona who enjoys spending time with my friends, doing some exercise, reading, meditating, and riding my bicycle. I am a few months away of getting my architecture degree._x000D_
_x000D_
A friend of mine convinced me into listing my extra room and it turn out to be one of the best experiences ever._x000D_
_x000D_
 Learning about other people and cultures is definitely something that I look forward. If you get around with either English, Spanish, or Italian, communication shouldn't be a problem. If not we will figure it out along the way._x000D_
_x000D_
I had the chance of travelling around the world and learn the beauty of getting to know other cultures. I hope my place can help you experience some of that._x000D_

This recently renovated and modernized apartment located in Palermo, is both close enough to Palermo's main attractions as well as a few blocks away in order to get tranquility and a sense of friendly neighbourhood.
The building has a modern entrance and three elevators.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment has a privileged location, it provides an excellent base to walk around the citie's landmarks and tourist attractions.

Palermo neihbourhood is friendly, attractive to tourists and has a lot to offer. Walking around is safe, easy and enjoyable.
You can access at a walking distance to lots of entertainment activities, such as a 15 minutes walk to Plaza Serrano, where many restaurants and shops are found, 10 minutes walk to worldwide known Parrilla Don Julio, etc. These are some examples of the prime location of the apartment.
There is a parking lot 20 metrrs from the apartment's front door. A pharmacie is right next to the building's door, numerous supermarkets are found in within a hundred meters radio.
Living, eating and loving in Palermo is possible and pleasant in this apartment!

It is 200 meters from Plaza San MartÃ­n, the GalerÃ­as PacÃ­fico and Calle Florida, and a few blocks from Buenos Aires landmarks such as the ColÃ³n theater, the Obelisk and the historic center of the city. Puerto Madero is located just 400 meters away. The neighborhood is lucky to SoHo porteÃ±o: on the one hand it has brought together plastic artists since the 1960s; on the other, although it is well known for its daytime shopping offer, it is home to a vibrant and varied nightlife. Beyond the obvious tourist attractions, the area has historic cafes, some of the best restaurants in Buenos Aires (including grills, Italian, Korean, Peruvian, Spanish, Indian, and excellent breweries), the traditional pubs of rue Reconquista, the new Carruajes Cente

neighborhood_overview:
Barrio Norte is an unofficial name to popularly refer to an area of the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires (Argentina) that includes part of the Retiro and Recoleta neighborhoods, and where upper-middle and upper-class residents predominate.

Barrio Norte is known by this name because it was formerly located north of the central area of the city. It can be located taking as limits the avenues CÃ³rdoba, 9 de Julio, del Libertador and Coronel DÃ­az, being Avenida Santa Fe its traditional axis. The Chinatown of Buenos Aires is a slice of the Belgrano neighborhood with a markedly oriental identity, which was defined as a result of a wave of retirement during the 1980s in which many Asian immigrant families were established.
neighborhood_overview:
The Chinatown of Buenos Aires is a slice of the Belgrano neighborhood with a markedly oriental identity, which was defined as a result of a wave of immigration during the 1980s in which many Asian immigrant families were established, mainly from Taiwan. These Chinese, Japanese, and Taiwanese families quickly changed the neighborhood's appearance with the opening of numerous Asian, local restaurants to the street, and even one of the city's first Buddhist temples, Chong Kuan Temple, opened in 1988, on MontaÃ±eses Street.

The best thing to recommend for a visit to the Chinatown is to enter through the imposing access archway, located in Juramento and ArribeÃ±os. This way, you'll see on either side of the street the shops and supermarkets with typical oriental products, from imported food to decor items or hose and anime venues (Japanese cartoons and cartoons and cartoons).

neighborhood_overview:
Palermo Soho is the trendiest and most vibrant neighborhood in Buenos Aires. This charming area is the perfect choice for those seeking a unique experience in the city.

Palermo Soho stands out for its bohemian atmosphere and eclectic style. Its cobbled streets are adorned with colorful graffiti and artistic murals, creating a creative and effervescent ambiance.

Explore independent design boutiques where you'll find cutting-edge fashion, unique accessories, and local art. Flea markets and craft fairs offer hidden treasures and authentic souvenirs. And when it's time to eat, Palermo Soho's restaurants and bars are a delight for food lovers, offering a wide range of options from local cuisine to international dishes.

The nightlife in Palermo Soho is famous throughout the city. Trendy bars and clubs come to life as the night falls, and music and fun are always in abundance.

Palermo Soho is the trendiest and most vibrant neighborhood in Buenos Aires. This charming area is the perfect choice for those seeking a unique experience in the city.

Palermo Soho stands out for its bohemian atmosphere and eclectic style. Its cobbled streets are adorned with colorful graffiti and artistic murals, creating a creative and effervescent ambiance.

Explore independent design boutiques where you'll find cutting-edge fashion, unique accessories, and local art. Flea markets and craft fairs offer hidden treasures and authentic souvenirs. And when it's time to eat, Palermo Soho's restaurants and bars are a delight for food lovers, offering a wide range of options from local cuisine to international dishes.

The nightlife in Palermo Soho is famous throughout the city. Trendy bars and clubs come to life as the night falls, and music and fun are always in abundance.

On the corner, you'll find the world-famous Don Julio Grill restaurant.
A few blocks from Plaza Serrano and Plaza Armenia. Surrounded by the best bars, restaurants and shops in Palermo Soho and Hollywood.
And very close to countless tourist attractions in the city: Forests of Palermo, Botanical Garden, Ecopark of the city (formerly Zoo), La Rural exhibition center, etc.).

Palermo is one of the most beautiful and safe neighborhoods in the city of Buenos Aires. Here you will find numerous gastronomic options, the latest trends in fashion and design and spaces destined for artistic and cultural expressions.
The neighborhood is quiet and at the same time walking distance to many tourist attractions day and night.
It is also close to public transportation that will take you to get to know the whole city!
One block from Shoping ALTO PALERMO
A few blocks from Las Heras Park, Avenida Libertador, Recollect cemetery. Surrounded by Palermo's best bars, restaurants and shopping
And very close to countless tourist attractions in the city: Forests of Palermo, Botanical Garden, Ecopark of the city (formerly Zoo), La Rural exhibition center, etc.).
In addition to wandering its streets, in Palermo Soho you can enjoy excellent cuisine.
